document_data.mainbody: '''Greed domain''' was a [[deity]] domain that granted divine spellcasters like [[cleric]]s with [[spell]]s and other powers related to greed, namely cheating, thieving, and otherwise generating wealth.{{cite book/Book of Vile Darkness|81}}<ref>
document_data.Powers: A priest with the Greed domain gained skill at appraising the worth of items and picking [[lock (item)|locks]] and picking pockets.
document_data.Spells: As they advanced, a priest with this domain could win a game of chance with ''[[cheat]]'', force others to give them things with ''[[entice gift]]'', and later even steal whole objects with ''[[vanish]]'' and ''[[phantasmal thief]]''. They could open locked or sealed doors with ''[[knock]]'' and secure their own possessions with ''[[guards and wards]]''. To make their own, they create items from raw materials with ''[[fabricate]]''. Finally, they could trigger strong feelings with ''[[emotion]]'' and ultimately attract creatures with ''[[sympathy]]''.
